body.name: The Secret: A Jack Reacher Novel
body.description: #1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • Don’t miss the hit streaming series Reacher! A string of mysterious deaths. A long-classified mission. A young MP with nothing to lose.1992. All across the United States respectable, upstanding citizens are showing up dead. These deaths could be accidents, and they don’t appear to be connected—until a fatal fall from a high-floor window attracts some unexpected attention. That attention comes from the secretary of defense. All of a sudden he wants an interagency task force to investigate. And he wants Jack Reacher as the army’s representative. If Reacher gets a result, great. If not, he’s a convenient fall guy. But office politics isn’t Reacher’s thing. Three questions quickly emerge: Who’s with him, who’s against him, and will the justice he dispenses be the official kind . . . or his own kind?

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #702 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #2 in Military Thrillers (Kindle Store) #2 in War & Military Action Fiction (Books) #5 in Action Thriller Fiction

reviews.reviewerName: Robert James Vandevoort (Show Low, Arizona)Robert James Vandevoort (Show Low, Arizona)
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Excellent Jack Reacher Series continues with the exciting new novel "The Secret".
reviews.reviewText: Authors Lee & Andrew Child bring Captain Jack Reacher, U.S. Army, back in time in their recent release of “The Secret”. The year is 1992. A situation has arisen where some accomplished persons are turning up dead. Jack Reacher was called in to investigate another problem area, but then was quickly transferred to another investigation related to persons of interest turning up dead. Jack joins a small team and the search is on for clues.The clues lead to an event that occurred in India back in December 1969. There was a chemical plant in India. There was a problem. A leak killed hundreds of workers at that plant. A news release was put out indicating just a few persons had died. A coverup? Most certainly, but by whom?There was a small-group of Americans working at that plant on top-secret business. They are the ones that are dying off in the United States. For Jack Reacher it was essential that he and the small team he was with, put the puzzle together. The puzzle is complex.For those that have enjoyed the Jack Reacher novels, this one was a whole lot of fun. The novel brought us back to his military days. These were days that Jack was a physical force and as expected Jack does solve several complicated problems!Thank you, Lee and Andrew, for keeping this great series alive!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just as described
reviews.reviewText: The book is "like new" as promised, so great value for the money. I have read all of the Reacher novels, and I'm 4 chapters into this one. I hope that Lee Child had more involvement in this than Andrew. They have been met since Andrew took the lead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classic Child's quality and suspense
reviews.reviewText: This duo clicks and their work just expands the "Reacher-verse"... It is a relief to know they will be expanding one of my favorite characters and series....This novel contained more character development and suspense, though not as action driven or fast paced as some of the earlier works. It rates a solid 4.5 stars however and is an interesting change of pace! Thoroughly enjoyed reading this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ugh, not the best.
reviews.reviewText: It is a very tiny list of writers that can keep a series going for over 20 books, and I think this writer(s) has finally hit the end. I am a Jack Reacher fan and have read them all. The last few have definitely not been up to the level of the first books, but have been readable. This one failed to keep my interest, almost being a chore to finish. The characters are flat and the plot been-there-done-that. There is no depth to the writing. It feels like they owed the publisher one more book so threw this together.It is one murder after another in which we are to believe agents are not smart enough to protect people they know are on a hit list. The scene where the agents almost capture one of the perpetrators is ridiculous with horrible dialogue.And Jack Reacher does very little for the first half of the book. The entire book could have been cut in half for better pacing. I think I will re-read the first 20 books and skip buying the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another fast paced thriller!
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book it was complicated and twisted at times but it had all the superb style of father Lee. I hope to see more of the same quality novels in the future. Well done!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Reacher is Back.
reviews.reviewText: This one started out a little slow, but after a few pages, it was back in the groove. It was good to see a little into the past. I'll hate to see Jack retire at some point, but it happens to all of us.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great Reacher novel
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the early days storyline. Although I look forward to new adventures that Reacher will have, there is plenty of room to share his Army career with us fans. I'm ready for the next boon, regardless of the timeline.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars better than most recent ones
reviews.reviewText: I’ve read them all. Love the character of Reacher. This book he is a little more human, I liked that as his character became stale in recent books. This one is set back in time when he was active military. The plot, although complex, was ok to follow, and the actions were within reason.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mejor que el anterior de ambos, como que Andrew va conociendo mejor a Jack
reviews.reviewText: Me gustó mucho, loma acabé muy pronto.
Familiar plot lines but can see more of Lee Child style than Andrew in this book. Good pace all through except the end was a bit rushed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Really think this Andrew Childs book hit the stride of an 'original' Reacher- very enjoyable.Interesting that a couple of small plot devices here appeared in the second season of the Reacher TV show and the fact that Reacher works as part of a small gang in this tips its hat towards being written with dramatisation in mind... but perhaps I'm reading too much into it.
Tengo casi todos los libros de jack reacher y me encantan.Lástima que no los traduzcan al español, que los compraría más gente.Mientras tanto nos arreglamos con las versiones en inglés.
